posts.name: Stewy
posts.cooked: Hi. As some background, im writing code but im having an issue. i asked CoPilot for an answer, it gave what sounds like a good answer but im not sure if its the correct answer to my problem. last years code we wrote the code ourselves(Mainly copy paste from previous years) but this year to make it easier, we used the CTRE Phoenix tuner and made the code base using that. made the new project and things look a little different. I’m working on code for the april tag and copied the code from last year to this year. Of course there were errors but that didn’t stop me until we got to coding the PID Controller imports. in previous code, we have Constants.Swerve.driveKP I did a search and could not find anything in constants. before i plan on importing the things into Constants, are there any things anywhere in the new code from CRTE that would be closly similar to swerve?

posts.name: Chris
posts.cooked: Honestly my advice would be to not use CoPilot. Copilot has almost never worked for me and always causes more issues in the future. But I would recommend just importing your constants into the Constants.java file you were using.

posts.name: Stewy
posts.cooked: That’s not my issue. I was asking, What in code do i look for to replace Swerve.driveKP. as a side note, CoPilot has helped us a few times. but this probably won’t be one of them.

posts.name: Chris
posts.cooked: Are you looking to change the value of “Swerve.driveKP” or are you looking to add that completely?

posts.name: Stewy
posts.cooked: No. In our previous codebase, we built our swerve code from the ground up, and put variables like Swerve.driveKP, Swerve.driveKI, and Swerve.driveKD into our previous constant file. This year, we used the built in CTRE tool to make our swerve code. I was wondering if these variables came in the CTRE made swerve code or if we would have to do some extra modification to properly call these values to move our robot in accordance with the april tags?

posts.name: Joe Lockwood
posts.cooked:
They are located under the generated folder in TunerConstants.java

enerated

Contribute to CrossTheRoadElec/Phoenix6-Examples development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Stewy
posts.cooked: Yes i know that. but where and what do i replace Swerve.driveKP with?

posts.name: Joe Lockwood
Stewy
posts.cooked: Do you know how i would write it as a Constants thing? like Constants.drivething.KP?

posts.name: Chris
posts.cooked: put the value in your constants then just reference it where you need it

posts.name: Chris
posts.cooked: so you would put the value in your constants just wherever. Then just do “.withKP(constants.yourvalue)”
